subtitle: the main difference between psychedelics and pharmaceuticals is really quite simple
pharmaceuticals are intended to treat something at its surface in the
form of temporary symptom management while psychedelics focus on the deeper
core of the issue and aim to permanently remove the root cause. The use of
psychedelics for healing is nothing new. humans have been using visionary plants
and fungus as medicine for thousands of years. we see examples of this in every
corner of the globe from ancient Egypt to the Aztecs
to Greek antiquity it is even a growing theory that Homo sapiens developed
bigger brains and a higher level of consciousness because they consumed
psilocybin mushrooms over hundreds of generations. although much of these plant
medicine rituals have been replaced by Western medicine, psychedelics are
revealing that they can be incredibly effective at solving our health issues
of today. for example psilocybe cubensis also known as magic mushrooms have been
proven to be powerful agents for curing depression anxiety and addiction when
used purposefully with the intention of healing since the 1960s psilocybin has
been widely regarded as a party drug used by young people at music festivals
and hippy drum circles. it is this stigma that has caused mushrooms and most other
psychedelics to be categorized as a highly illegal Schedule 1 drug, the
possession of which is a felony under federal law and can land you 20 years in
prison. so for the last 60 years the medicinal benefits of mushrooms were
disregarded and in place came the rise of massive pharmaceutical companies that
profited off a perpetually sick population but things are changing and
thankfully science is opening the door to psychedelic research and new
possibilities after decades of stigma and resistance the gap between spirit

end-all cures to mental health disorders we must first
